Pre-Game Insights: Jose Berrios returns to Target Field where he was pulled after just three innings during Game 2 of last season’s wild-card round.
Berrios enters the game with a 1.88 ERA and has limited opponents to a.212 batting average over his last four starts.
The Twins have handled right-handers well this season but have cooled off a bit down the stretch, ranking 19th in batting average and 21st in OPS over their last 15 games.
Toronto’s lineup has been much better in the second half of the season, despite being shut down by Pablo Lopez last night.
Zebby Mathews, the Twins’ rookie starter, shouldn't be favored by this much in this spot.
